Not be so sure, since you are in fact, right. And my initial sentence was plain wrong, since gtest [does not offer a timeout functionality](https://code.google.com/p/googletest/issues/detail?id=348). It is CTest which implements this for our testsuite.

Even with this, I'm not sure than we want to keep them into our unit tests. Use cases I can see:

 * Developing and running standalone test: if it stucks, the developer is just looking. CTRL+C. You know its not working.
 * Running test suite: it should be run from make test command, with implements proper timeout. 

Maybe I'm missing other useful cases. Open for discussion to me.
